CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: In these two cases , AFM height images showed similar surface morphology with fairly small phase separation , and the root-mean-square ( rms ) values for the blend films from DCB and from TCB are 0.242 and 0.306 nm , respectively. These AFM results are consistent with their photovoltaic device performances ( vide supra ). The reason for that may be due to both DCB and TCB are good solvents for PSFDTBT. It is well - known that balanced electron and hole mobility of the active layer is required for high performance polymer solar cells. 2f The formation of an interpenetrating bicontinuous network between polymer donor and PCBM with an ideal domain size of 10-20 nm is crucial for charge generation and transportation. 18 For bulk heterojunction polymer solar cells , appreciate phase separation is a practical way to form bicontinuous donor - acceptor network. 19 We believe that the solar cell performance of this type of copolymer can be further improved by the optimization of film morphology and device fabrication conditions . An alternating copolymer PSFDTBT of spirobifluorene and 2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole unit was designed and synthesized. PSFDTBT shows a broad absorption , appropriate HOMO / LUMO positions , and comparable hole mobility. Without using any additive and any post-treatment , polymer solar cells based on PSFDTBT / PC71BM demonstrated a PCE of 4.6% with a high open - circuit voltage of 0.94 V. This is the first report on spirobifluorene - based polymers applied in BHJ PSCs. High open - circuit voltage , simple device fabrication process , and easy synthesis make PSFDTBT a highly promising donor polymers for high efficiency polymer solar cells. We believe that spirobifluorene as a promising building block for conjugated polymer donor materials warrants further exploration and the performance of PSFDTBT - based polymer solar cells can be further improved from the optimization of device fabrication conditions .

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PSFDTBT |
| DCB |
| TCB |
| PS71BM |
| PCBM |

Note:

* PSFDTBT is a copolymer of spirobifluorene and 2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole unit.
* DCB and TCB are solvents for PSFDTBT.
* PS71BM and PCBM are acceptor materials used in polymer solar cells.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PSFDTBT |
| PC71BM |
| PCBM |

Note:

* PSFDTBT is a copolymer of spirobifluorene and 2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole unit.
* PC71BM and PCBM are acceptor materials used in polymer solar cells.

The entities "DCB" and "TCB" were removed as they refer to solvents and not material names.

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: In these two cases , AFM height images showed similar surface morphology with fairly small phase separation , and the root-mean-square ( rms ) values for the blend films from DCB and from TCB are 0.242 and 0.306 nm , respectively. These AFM results are consistent with their photovoltaic device performances ( vide supra ). The reason for that may be due to both DCB and TCB are good solvents for PSFDTBT. It is well - known that balanced electron and hole mobility of the active layer is required for high performance polymer solar cells. 2f The formation of an interpenetrating bicontinuous network between polymer donor and PCBM with an ideal domain size of 10-20 nm is crucial for charge generation and transportation. 18 For bulk heterojunction polymer solar cells , appreciate phase separation is a practical way to form bicontinuous donor - acceptor network. 19 We believe that the solar cell performance of this type of copolymer can be further improved by the optimization of film morphology and device fabrication conditions . An alternating copolymer PSFDTBT of spirobifluorene and 2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole unit was designed and synthesized. PSFDTBT shows a broad absorption , appropriate HOMO / LUMO positions , and comparable hole mobility. Without using any additive and any post-treatment , polymer solar cells based on PSFDTBT / PC71BM demonstrated a PCE of 4.6% with a high open - circuit voltage of 0.94 V. This is the first report on spirobifluorene - based polymers applied in BHJ PSCs. High open - circuit voltage , simple device fabrication process , and easy synthesis make PSFDTBT a highly promising donor polymers for high efficiency polymer solar cells. We believe that spirobifluorene as a promising building block for conjugated polymer donor materials warrants further exploration and the performance of PSFDTBT - based polymer solar cells can be further improved from the optimization of device fabrication conditions .

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| rms (root-mean-square) value for the blend films from DCB | 0.242 nm |
| rms (root-mean-square) value for the blend films from TCB | 0.306 nm |
| ideal domain size for charge generation and transportation | 10-20 nm |
| open-circuit voltage of PSFDTBT/PC71BM polymer solar cells | 0.94 V |
| PCE (power conversion efficiency) of PSFDTBT/PC71BM polymer solar cells | 4.6% |

Note:

* rms (root-mean-square) value is a measure of the roughness of the surface morphology, and it is expressed in units of nanometers (nm).
* domain size refers to the size of the bicontinuous donor-acceptor network, and it is expressed in units of nanometers (nm).
* open-circuit voltage (Voc) is a measure of the maximum voltage that can be produced by a solar cell, and it is expressed in units of volts (V).
* power conversion efficiency (PCE) is a measure of the efficiency of a solar cell in converting sunlight into electrical energy, and it is expressed as a percentage (%).

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 0.242 nm |
| 0.306 nm |
| 10-20 nm |

Note:

* The entities that were removed from the original list are:
 + "ideal domain size" (not a direct reference to a material property)
 + "open-circuit voltage" (not a direct reference to a material property)
 + "PCE" (not a direct reference to a material property)

The remaining entities are:

* 0.242 nm and 0.306 nm (rms values for the blend films from DCB and TCB, respectively)
* 10-20 nm (ideal domain size for charge generation and transportation)
